; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 08:25:03 +0800 失落的1945——张爱玲“笔误”解谜丨云端http://www.infzm.com/contents/257677
;;2023-09-26 23:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Manuscript of Zhang Ailing's novel "Little Reunion". ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;;"I forgot again";

;

;Zhang Ailing There are many examples of poor memory. Reading the 700,000-word "Collected Letters of Zhang Ailing" edited by Song Yilang and recently published by Crown has deepened this feeling.

;

;In the past, Zhang Ailing’s bad memory focused on dates and numbers. The more famous "public case" is about the "Genius Dream" which gave birth to Zhang's famous saying "Life is a gorgeous robe, covered with lice". Until her later years, Zhang Ailing was still bitter about the "unfair treatment" she suffered in the "West Wind" essay competition when she was 19 years old. However, scholars and Zhang fans have verified that she remembered everything wrong, whether it was the limit on the number of words in the essay, the format of the essay, or even the awards. , and maybe I didn’t read the specific terms of the essay advertisement clearly back then. The number of words in the competition was limited to 5,000, but she mistakenly thought it was 500; when she finally won the third honorary award, she wrote it as a "special award"; she even recorded the more than 1,500 words of her award-winning article as more than 490 words.

;

;I was looking through old magazines at home not long ago and accidentally found the July 2004 issue of "Yin Ke". In this issue of Zhang Ailing's album, there was published a letter she wrote to the Chinese Embassy in Washington on June 4, 1966. Letter from the British Embassy. At the time, Eileen Chang was interested in applying for a position as a writer-in-residence at a university and required proof of academic qualifications. Due to the loss of her documents, she wrote to the University of Hong Kong to request a replacement. However, the Registrar of the University of Hong Kong only certified that she had "two ins and two outs" and did not mention that she had received a certificate for her excellent academic performance. Scholarships and other honors, several negotiations failed. At that time, Hong Kong was still under British rule, so she wrote to the British Embassy in Washington for help. To explain his situation, there is this paragraph in the letter of more than a thousand words: "...I immigrated to the United States in 1955, married an American in the 1960s, and obtained American citizenship. My mother has been naturalized as a British citizen, and she was a British citizen in 1958. Passed away in London..."

;

;I had never read this letter before, and I was very interested. But I was really surprised when I read this: She and Laiya registered their marriage in August 1956, the second year after arriving in the United States. On August 14th and August 18th, she also wrote to Kuang Wenmei, why did it suddenly become the "60s"? Her mother Huang Yifan died of illness in London on October 11, 1957. On October 24, she accurately reported in a letter to Song Qi and his wife that her mother had "died two weeks ago", but the letter to the embassy read "1958" in black and white. .

;

;;

;

;The photo that her mother took with her when she left China returned to Zhang Ailing after her death. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;This letter was translated into Chinese by Chen Ziyu, and Su Weizhen wrote the introduction. Neither of them discovered it, so it was also There is no "clerical error" noted in the letter. Indeed, no one would have thought that in 1966, Zhang Ailing was 46 years old and was only middle-aged. No matter how bad her memory was, she would not have mistaken the year of her mother's death and the year of her remarriage. Moreover, she wrote a formal letter to an official agency. inside.

;

;So, when I saw so many "I remembered wrongly" and "I forgot again" in the collection of letters between Zhang Ailing and Song Qi, I was no longer surprised. Zhang Ailing lives largely on royalties in the United States, but she can't even figure out whether Crown Publishing's fixed royalties for a certain period of time are US$2,000 for half a year or a year. What's even more outrageous is that before leaving Hong Kong for the United States in 1955, with the help of Song Qi, she advanced all the royalties for two scripts from the Telecom Company, but she forgot all about it five years later. Only after being reminded by Kwong Wenmei did she remember that she had done so. This is the case. It is simply unbelievable that a person who is most afraid of owing money or favors would forget such a sum of money.

;

;In the past few days, I have been browsing a collection of essays by book reviewer Liu Zheng, and I came across an article titled "Zhang Ailing Remembers Wrongly", which records the errors in words, sources, plots, and mistakes in Zhang Ailing's works. , a total of 22 cases, which is eye-opening. Regarding citation errors, I also read in Chen Zishan's "Cong Kao of Zhang Ailing" that Zhang Ailing quoted Lu Xun's translation of the Soviet writer Shuxue Jianke (also translated as Zuoqenko) in 1926 in "Talk about Eating and Painting Cake to Appease Hungry". The short story "Women of a Noble Family" in 2000 was mistakenly written as "Baozi"; while "Baozi" written by Zhang Ailing was actually translated by Lu Xun as "Meat Buns".

;

;Both Chen Zishan and Liu Zheng are sharp-eyed and knowledgeable, but they still respect Zhang Ailing. Liu Zheng said this: "In terms of human relations and physics, as well as in choosing words and sentences, Zhang Ailing can be said to be a very thoughtful person. However, she did not seem to care much about whether the quotations were accurate. In addition, it was very difficult to check the information at that time. Zhang Ailing She doesn’t have the habit of collecting books, so it’s normal to have some misremembering when quoting. To put it into perspective, Zhang Ailing obviously doesn’t have a ‘photographic memory’, maybe she just has a poor memory; what she left behind There are really not too many clerical errors."

;

;Liu Zheng explained that he had no other intention in writing down these when he was studying, but just for fun - Zhang Ailing would also remember it wrong! At the end of the article, a sentence from Sontag's novel "The Volcano Lover" was quoted: "Genius, like beauty, everything, well almost everything, will be forgiven."

;

;Interestingly, He attributed the clerical errors to memory and unverified information. On the contrary, Zhang Ailing said in "Contrast Notes": Freud, the master of psychological analysis, believed that there is no clerical error or an occasional wrong word, it is all what he thought in his heart and revealed it inadvertently.

;

;But it was also in "Contrast Notes" that Zhang Ailing left another famous "clerical error": the well-documented "cool party" in Shanghai on July 21, 1945 The photo taken with Li Xianglan was annotated as "Meet the movie star Li Xianglan at a garden party in 1943." As if following the Freudian line of thinking mentioned by Eileen Chang, two scholars have tried to analyze whether Chang Eileen's "clerical error" of "one or two years" was just due to poor memory, or there is another meaningful reason behind it. .

;

;;1945;;Cooling Party/1943 Garden Party;

;

;"Comparative Notes - Looking at Old Photo Albums" is Zhang Ailing's last work This work is also her only autobiographical collection of pictures and texts. "Picture 41" in the book is a photo of her and Li Xianglan that has been treasured for nearly 50 years. She wrote: In 1943, she met Li Xianglan at a garden party and wanted to take a photo together. She was too tall and the two of them would complement each other if they stood side by side. , someone asked her to sit down, and Li Xianglan stood aside.

;

;;

;

;In 1943, Zhang Ailing and Li Xianglan (right) took a photo in Shanghai. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;"The book "After Yun" mentions clothes made from the quilt cover of my grandmother's bed. This is the one. My aunt took it apart and kept it. Although the tailor said that 'chen silk is like rotten grass', the tailor did not frown, took it without saying a word, and made it according to Yanying's design. The beige thin silk was sprinkled with light The ink dots hide a dark purple phoenix, which is very picturesque. I have never seen a similar pattern elsewhere."

;

;"1943", this year is ridiculously wrong, the correct time and place is: July 1945 On the 21st, a "cool party" hosted by "Magazine" was held at No. 2 Xianyang Road, Shanghai. The basis is "Magazine" in August 1945, which published the article "Records of Enjoying the Cool Coolness". In addition to this picture of Zhang Ailing and Li Xianglan, there is another group photo: Li Xianglan and Zhang Ailing maintain the same posture, and Zhang Ailing's aunt is also seen. Zhang Maoyuan, his best friend Yan Ying, an unidentified Ms. Chen, and two men in long gowns - Chen Binhe, the president of the Shenbao Press during the Wang puppet period, and Jin Xiongbai, the president of the Pingbao Press. According to Shao Yingjian, a Chinese scholar who studied in Japan and is now a researcher in Japan, in the book "The Legendary Literature and Rumor Life of Zhang Ailing", Xianyang Road was the name of the current Shaanxi South Road from 1943 to 1945. It was older. The name familiar to Shanghainese is "Yalpe Road". No. 2 Xianyang Road was the garden of Jin Xiongbai’s private residence at that time.

;

;In 1994, when "Contrast" was published, it was the year before Zhang Ailing's death. In her declining years, she had to study the skirt that she had changed from her grandmother's old quilt cover, from the texture, color, pattern, Patterns, origins, styles, designs, and tailors are all fresh and clear in my memory. Why do I remember the wrong time and place when I took the photo? What kind of information does this 1943, this "clerical error" reveal?

;

;Shao Yingjian believes that if you understand Zhang Ailing’s life, this mystery will not be difficult to solve. For Zhang Ailing, 1943 to 1945 were the most glorious days in this life. She wrote "Legend" and "Rumors" in just two years, and she rose to the top of the literary world when she was just starting out. "In the database of the brain, this is a A perfect file, with no details, displayed in its entirety on the screen of memory." - This statement is very tempting: in the stage of life when the fire is burning, the oil is blooming, and the flowers are blooming, the memory is mixed and unclear.

;

;As for what Shao Yingjian pointed out, Zhang Ailing wrote "cooling party" as "garden party", in my opinion, it does not seem to be a clerical error, just like some people say that going to a "theater" or "cinema" to watch a movie is not a mistake. substantial difference. But researcher Shao focused on the difference between the two words and found his answer - interestingly, he also made a "clerical error". After checking several versions of "Contrast Notes", Zhang Ailing wrote "Garden Party" Rather than a "garden party" - he found out from the old "Declaration" that on July 8, 1944, the Wang Puppet "Shanghai Press Association" held a party in the central square of Hartung Garden, attended by thousands of people from all walks of life. "Citizen Garden Lecture", the program includes red star singing and movie card screening.

;

;Although he did not specifically mention the red star singing that night or the celebrities attending the meeting, Shao Wen determined that the red star was "most likely" the popular Li Xianglan, and Zhang Ailing, who is already a celebrity in the maritime literary world, "naturally" should also Be present. He deduced from this that it was on this occasion that Zhang Ailing and Li Xianglan met for the first time: "...the first tangible and tangible meeting was at this garden party. The impression on them was profound and indelible. As the years passed, As time went by, the subsequent impressions became shallow and flat, leaving only this scratch. How many years later, in Zhang Ailing’s brain inventory, all the fate with Li Xianglan was merged into this time."

; < p>;He further said that when Zhang Ailing stood on the balcony of her apartment (Eddington Apartment, today's Changde Apartment), she could see a corner of Hartung Garden. Hartung Garden can also be regarded as Zhang Ailing’s neighborhood. Zhang Ailing also mentioned this legendary garden twice in her 1944 serial "Serial Set" in Vientiane. "Although the scale of Jin Xiongbai's private garden and Hartung Garden are not the same, there are some similarities: they are both Western-style houses with flower beds and lawns. Just based on the background of the photo and the Western-style cushion chairs, in Zhang Ailing's memory, , unknowingly, the garden of Jin Xiongbai's private residence was replaced by Hartung Garden, and the 'cooling party' also turned into a 'garden party.'"

;

;That's right. One thing is certain: Zhang Ailing has never mentioned and has not seen any information showing that she has been to the "garden party" in Hartung Gardens. Therefore, Mr. Shao's discussion based on assumptions has a strong reasoning component and is more like a It is a imaginative fiction. The mystery of forgetting is complicated and confusing, but a convincing analysis comes from Professor Wong Sham-cun, Chairman of the Department of Comparative Literature at the University of Hong Kong. In a wonderful essay, she spent six and a half pages discussing the photo of Zhang Ailing and Li Xianglan taken three weeks before Japan surrendered, and put forward a meaningful "maybe".

;

;;“I don’t remember a thing in this year”;

;

;“Picture 50” in “Contrast Notes” is a picture of Zhang Ailing leaving Hong Kong in 1955 In the photo before America, the makeup is exquisite, the side face is lowered and the eyes are downcast. Eileen Chang described taking a boat from Hong Kong and passing through Honolulu. The customs officer was a skinny Japanese young man who clearly filled out her entry form: height 6 feet 6 and a half inches and weight 102 pounds. She laughed at the young man's carelessness and made a Freudian slip by writing 5 feet 6 and a half inches as 6 feet 6 and a half inches. "I am thin and look very tall. That is the shocking record of this customs officer."

;

;;

;

;"Contrast Notes" contains photos of Zhang Ailing before she left Hong Kong for the United States in 1955. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;"Picture 41" in "Contrast Notes", Zhang Ailing was "careless" and mistakenly recorded as "1943" "Year" frame with Li Xianglan is considered by scholars to be the most important photo of her in Shanghai. Professor Huang Xincun has a paper "Mottled Light and Shadow: Zhang Ailing's Japan and East Asia", and his analysis starts from this photo. Taken on July 21, 1945, just three weeks before the end of World War II and Japan’s surrender, “Its strange composition and uncoordinated visual style are also impressive. Viewers who are familiar with the background of the photo even regard it as a depiction.” On the eve of the collapse of the Japanese Empire, a visual allegory of the crumbling Japanese-Chinese combination.”

;

;Professor Huang’s analysis of the photo focuses on the different expressions of Zhang Ailing and Li Xianglan, the strange composition of the photo, and their different dressing styles, especially It’s Zhang Ailing’s perverse sitting posture, her downward gaze away from the camera, and all the details. She said, "Zhang Ailing's facial expressions and body may imply resistance or contempt, but more importantly, she obviously knows how to turn the gaze of the camera lens on her into a help to deepen her own image."

;

;What I am more interested in is how did Zhang Ailing, her aunt, and Yan Ying go to this "garden party" three weeks before Japan was defeated? Japan unconditionally surrendered on August 15, and the current situation suddenly changed. Hu Lancheng, who had been an important member of the Wang Puppet Government, was wanted by the Nationalist Government and fled hastily. How did it bring shock and panic to Zhang Ailing?

;

;Suddenly it occurred to me that I should review "Little Reunion". What happened in the long summer of 1945 is described in the book. Moreover, at the beginning of Chapter 8, what Zhang Ailing wrote about Jiuli was simply an annotation in advance for her subsequent "clerical error":

;

;"From this time until the end of World War II , for more than half a year, there was a kind of chaos in her heart, which was sealed with a layer of white wax, which was a sense of calm and security on the surface. What happened during this period was always regarded as the previous year or the next year. "...I don't remember a single thing in this year. It can be called a lost year."

;

;"When she first met him, she knew that he was going to flee after the war, but she became confused when things happened. , also because this was her 'lost year' and she was devastated."

;

;Despondent, she banished 1945 in her heart.

;

;"Maybe Zhang Ailing herself doesn't want to believe that this photo was taken on the eve of Japan's defeat." Huang Xincun wrote a sentence in the "Notes" of the paper that is heart-stopping. Yes, there is no 1945, only 1943, only the previous year or the next year. Although "Contrast" was published in 1994, half a century after those unbearable and chaotic days, she still remembered that there was a kind of Freudian error.

;

;Psychology has a lot to say about memory and forgetting. Whether Zhang Ailing left defective memories a year before her death was due to retrograde amnesia caused by damage to the hippocampus of the brain, or active forgetting of emotional memories, it is no longer a question. Of course, exploring the secrets involved is not to "disenchant". As Huang Xinchun said, it is only to "restore a historical Eileen Chang" and "a more complex Eileen Chang".

;

;Subconsciously shielding the unbearable past and deleting the dark aspects on the memory chip. Isn’t it true for us, many ordinary "people"?

;

;I strongly agree with this statement: What ultimately constitutes a person's life is not experience, spirituality, or any events, but the memory, description, and interpretation of all these experiences.

;

;Matsuo Basho has a haiku: The temple bell/stopped, but the lingering sound in the flowers/continues to echo

;

;On September 19, the Central Inspection Leading Group held a centralized feedback meeting on the first round of inspections of the 20th Central Committee. The meeting conveyed and studied the spirit of General Secretary Xi Jinping’s important speech when he listened to the Central Committee’s first round of inspection reports, informed the common problems discovered during the inspection, and made arrangements for rectification during the inspection. Liu Jinguo, secretary of the Central Secretariat and deputy leader of the Central Inspection Leading Group, attended the meeting and delivered a speech.

;

;From September 20th to 22nd, 15 central inspection teams conducted "one-on-one" meetings with the party groups of 30 medium-sized enterprises, 5 party committees of medium-sized financial enterprises, and the party group of the State Sports General Administration during this round of inspections. feedback. ;

;Feedback pointed out that in recent years, centrally managed enterprises and financial enterprises have faced the complex and severe external environment and the impact of the epidemic. They have withstood the test and bravely shouldered heavy responsibilities. They have been successful in winning the battle against poverty and promoting high-level scientific and technological self-reliance. It has made important contributions in building a new development pattern, promoting high-quality development, coordinating epidemic prevention and control, and economic and social development, and has made new progress in building a sports power.

;

;The feedback seriously pointed out the outstanding problems existing in the fields of state-owned enterprises, finance and sports. Some fail to implement the decisions and arrangements of the Party Central Committee, do not have a deep understanding of the responsibilities and missions they shoulder, and have gaps in their performance of duties; some do not coordinate development and safety, have weak risk awareness, and have insufficient prevention and control mechanisms; some implement party management The responsibility for party governance is not in place, the pressure transmission is decreasing layer by layer, the implementation of the strict tone is weak, the integrity risks of key positions such as "top leaders" are relatively prominent, the problem of "depending on the enterprise to take advantage of the enterprise" is common, the "four styles" problem is prominent, and it violates the eight central regulations Mental problems still occur; there are weak links in the construction of some leadership groups and cadre talent teams, and the political functions of grassroots party organizations need to be strengthened.

;

;The feedback requires that the inspected units should thoroughly study Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era, conscientiously study and implement the spirit of General Secretary Xi Jinping’s important speech when he listened to the inspection report, and fully implement the deployment of the 20th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. Uphold and strengthen the party's leadership, firmly establish and practice a correct view of political performance, completely, accurately and comprehensively implement the new development concept, adhere to functional positioning, focus on main responsibilities and main businesses, and promote high-quality development. It is necessary to resolutely implement the political responsibility to prevent and resolve major risks, establish bottom-line thinking and extreme thinking, comprehensively sort out and investigate hidden risks, plug leaks and fill gaps, resolve risks and recover losses, and effectively safeguard national interests. ;

Other members of the team must conscientiously perform "one post, two responsibilities", strictly compare feedback opinions, and establish a problem list, task list, and responsibility list. ;The feedback requires that the responsibilities of all parties for rectification should be consolidated and efforts should be made in the same direction to solve the problem. Discipline inspection and supervision agencies must strengthen daily supervision of rectification, focus on key issues, focus on specific people and specific matters, strengthen on-the-spot inspections, grasp the real situation, and seize examples of those who deal with perfunctory or false rectifications and seriously hold accountable them. The organizational department should strengthen research and guidance based on the inspection situation, and promote the solution of outstanding problems in the construction of leadership teams, cadres and talent teams, and grassroots party organizations. Relevant functional departments must comprehensively make full use of the inspection results, strengthen daily supervision of common and deep-seated problems reflected in the inspection, deepen reforms in key areas, optimize policy supply, and improve systems and mechanisms. Inspection agencies must strengthen overall coordination and supervision, establish and improve rectification work mechanisms, and report important situations to the Party Central Committee in a timely manner.

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 22:55:03 +0800 专访胡歌：如果不做演员，生活里的我应该什么样？http://www.infzm.com/contents/257715

;

;Throughout September, Hu Ge’s work was fully scheduled. He had just attended related activities at the Venice Film Festival, and then flew back to Beijing to attend the premiere of the movie "It's Worth It".

;

;;

;

;Hu Ge (left) and "It's Worth It" director Liu Jiayin at a business dinner at the Shanghai International Film Festival in June 2023. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In order to promote this low-cost literary film, Hu Ge traveled to seven cities in nine days, non-stop to Group after group of viewers shared their feelings about the male protagonist Wen Shan. He said: "When I meet a character I like, I am not playing him, but becoming him."

;

;The film's director Liu Jiayin expressed his "jealousy" of Hu Ge: "This character is obviously mine. But I feel like you understand him better than I do. Now I understand that the extra thing is yourself."

;

;Wen Shan is nearly forty years old and was once a failed entrepreneur. The screenwriter, because he believes that "ordinary people can also be the protagonist", has never been able to write a script that satisfies Party A. Over time, he gradually lost confidence in himself and gave up this career. The character that he could not write became a part of his heart, transforming into a boy named Xiao Yin, who often jumped out of his mind to talk to him.

;

;When Wen Shan was in school, he liked to go to funeral parlors and zoos to take notes on his life, which later became a habit. After his life fell into embarrassment, he accidentally found a new job - writing articles for clients to commemorate their deceased relatives and friends. After completing an article, he could get 4,000 yuan, which could just cover his room and board expenses in the suburbs of Beijing.

;

;Wen Shan always wears baggy clothes that have been washed too many times. He is habitually hunched over and has long hair that covers his eyes. He cuts his nails frequently because of typing all the time. He likes to buy large buckets of mineral water and directly Lift it up and drink.

;

;At first glance, there is not much connection between the frustrated Wen Shan and Hu Ge himself, except that the latter has also come into contact with many screenwriters at work. Hu Ge told the Southern Weekend reporter with some regret: "This industry is sometimes quite abnormal. Unless the screenwriter is a big shot, he has almost no power of expression. Most of the time, he can only wait to be evaluated, without even a chance to refute. ”

;

;In Hu Ge’s eyes, Wen Shan is a person who is unwilling to compromise. It’s not that he doesn’t know how to write (scripts) to gain favor, but he is unwilling to do things he doesn’t want to do. "I hope to be such a person, but often I can't. I envy him very much." Hu Ge said.

;

;At the beginning of 2023, Hu Ge suddenly disclosed the news of getting married and having a daughter on Weibo. It quickly became a hot search list and there were constant discussions on the Internet. He did not hesitate to share the joy of becoming a father for the first time: "When I held my daughter for the first time, it was like holding a piece of tofu. I was afraid that I would break her if I shook her."

;

;"Get married and have children. I have considered this before, but never took action. I made this decision after playing the role of Wen Shan. This role brought me a lot of changes and influence. After playing this role, I have a lot of confidence to do it. I think it’s a choice that should be made,” Hu Ge told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Twenty years after his debut, Hu Ge is no longer a young guy like Li Xiaoyao in "Legend of Sword and Fairy", but closer to Mei Changsu who narrowly escaped death in "Nirvana in Fire". Attentive viewers will find that whenever the shots of "It's Worth It" show a close-up of Hu Ge, the scar on his right eye is clearly visible. He has already been able to face the impact of the car accident in 2006. In the first two or three scenes after the car accident, Hu Ge used his bangs to cover the scar, but then he let it go: "If I can't pass this test myself, how can I let others accept it?"

;

;After works such as "Nirvana in Fire" and "The Pretender", the audience began to pay attention to Hu Ge's acting skills, and he decided to "stop" and "put down some of his current work and concentrate on experiencing life." After a few years, "It's Worth It" may be regarded as Hu Ge's answer. With this film, he won the Best Actor Award at the 25th Shanghai International Film Festival. At the award ceremony, he said: " When an actor truly falls in love with a character, he will give himself completely to the character."

;

;;

;

;Hu Ge rests at the closing ceremony of the 25th Shanghai International Film Festival district. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;One afternoon in mid-September 2023, a reporter from Southern Weekend interviewed Hu Ge via online connection , the original interview time was only half an hour, but Hu Ge said: "It doesn't matter, I am willing to chat more."

;

;The following is Hu Ge's self-report:

;

;He has me in him The Firmness That Is Not Possessed

;

;"It's Worth It" talks about ordinary people, allowing many viewers to see themselves in it. (I) traveled to seven cities to do road shows, and the audience was willing to share their own experiences of facing the death of relatives and friends when communicating. This is where I can most empathize. This script has many intersections with my own life.

;

;A few years ago, my mother passed away, and I wrote the eulogy myself. So when I first read the script, I was not Wen Shan, but one of his clients. I still haven't fully recovered from this experience, and it will take me a long time to accept the end of my life.

;

;Before this, I had never thought that there were people like Wen Shan in my life. In our traditional culture, we seem to be very shy about talking about death and the end of life. Therefore, when a loved one passes away, it is usually difficult to find someone to share and talk to. This script gave me a warm feeling.

;

;Wen Shan has another meaning to me. In current terms, he is an "i person" (Editor's note: a result of the MBTI personality test that has become popular in recent years, and "e person" ” In contrast, the two are approximately equivalent to introverts and extroverts respectively), introverts. He is not good at expressing himself or getting along with others. To be honest, the real me may be such a character. But he has a firmness that I don't have, and he won't change his choices because of external evaluations and so-called worldly standards. This is something I envy.

;

;I saw in him a part of myself that I couldn’t achieve, my ideal look, and I really wanted to be him. Even though he is not a person with a strong sense of presence, he is still very dignified at heart. This kind of axis is a kind of courage, persistence and courage to me.

;

;I am an i person at heart, but I don’t look like me. This may have something to do with my career and environment. As an i person, Wenshan is more able to stick to his own choices, but I often can't.

;

;As a screenwriter, Wen Shan seems not to be that successful, not because of ability, but because of choice. He insists on his own aesthetic and is unwilling to change his creative direction. Throughout his career, he had almost no opportunity to express himself, and his works were always rejected by others before he could complete them. But what is rare is that he never said that he must seek the approval of others. This is an inner persistence.

;

;The turning point in Wen Shan’s life was that by chance, he got the job of writing eulogies for others. Although this job is completely different from being a screenwriter, they are both creating with words. At work, Wen Shan found a sense of identity. This did not mean that everyone praised him for writing well, but that he used his kindness and sincerity to influence others through constant communication. For example, Mr. Wang in the film re-understood his deceased father through Wen Shan's eulogy. This is the meaning of Wen Shan's work.

;

;;

;

;In the movie "It's Worth It", the son of client Mr. Wang reveals his secret to Wen Shan (right), played by Hu Ge, and Wen Shan discovers the mutual relationship between the family. The love without words. ;(Photo courtesy of the film producer);

;

;But I don’t think the main thing expressed in "A Worthwhile Journey" is death. Writing Death is about how we write life. Wen Shan has gone from being a screenwriter to writing eulogies. He is using his pen to create characters and write other people's stories. Looking back, we are writing our own lives with our daily lives.

;

;People will change at every stage, but it has nothing to do with specific age, but has to do with experience. In 2019, my mother passed away, and then we went through another three years of the epidemic and saw a lot of separation and death. In this process, I think not only me, but many people will think more about life.     

;

;Most people are the protagonists

;

;What do you mean by ordinary people? Ordinary people are not particularly mediocre people as usually understood, but relative to those who have the aura of the protagonist. The latter often have particularly strong dramatic conflicts and many miracles happen in their lives. But ordinary people are the majority in life. It is difficult to meet people like the protagonists of idol dramas in our lives.

;

;The film emphasizes that "ordinary people can also be protagonists", which means that most people are protagonists. Our definition of success seems to be too standardized, and everything has become very utilitarian. In fact, everyone's trajectory is different. Sometimes if we set our vision and goals too uniformly, it is easy to miss the truly important things in life.

;

;For individuals, we are already in our own story and in our own growth trajectory. Of course you are your own protagonist. Why do you have to treat yourself as a supporting role? (Why) Do we have to call the character who conforms to the so-called concept of success the protagonist?

;

;I am a person who is often easily entangled, and my inner self is very close to that of Wen Shan. It is just because of my various good luck that my life is like an idol drama. From the inside, I do have question marks about my life.

;

;Wen Shan is different from the characters I have portrayed in the past. Almost all characters have the aura of the protagonist. Even if they have some flaws, they must have particularly powerful abilities. They are the so-called "tragic heroes" ". In the past, when I created characters, I was doing additions. I had to superimpose various abilities on my body to reach the character. But this time I was doing subtractions. I needed to take off all the things attached to my body and return to my original self. To put it simply, if I don’t become an actor, what should I be like in life?

;

;This time I did not deliberately design any actions. When I created Wen Shan, I was not trying to play this character, but to become him. Therefore, I did not use any special external methods, but got close to the character first. In my heart, other things are just a natural expression.

;

;Xiao Yin is the mirror image of Wenshan's heart. As a listener, Wenshan is lonely and can rarely find someone to talk to. He has to learn to get along with himself. The existence of Xiao Yin is to use a special way to show how lonely people get along with themselves, so that at least he is not lonely.

;

;;

;

;In the movie "It's Worth It", Wen Shan (left) played by Hu Ge and his inner Xiao Yin (right, played by Wu Lei). ;(Photo courtesy of the film producer);

;

;The really sad thing is that lonely people have to endure loneliness. Loneliness but not loneliness is a relative ideal state. Xiao Yin is the more active and bold part of Wen Shan's heart, but this side has been suppressed, and there has always been self-confrontation and entanglement in his heart. Xiao Yin has been pushing Wenshan to face reality more bravely. In the end, Xiao Yin disappeared, which meant that Wenshan found the confidence to continue writing as a screenwriter, allowing Xiao Yin to return to the script world.

;

;I am afraid that there is more than one Xiao Yin in my body, and there are often some small divisions.

;

;The actor is a gorilla in the zoo

;

;Wen Shanhui often observes the surrounding environment and people, and takes notes on life. The two most important scenes in the film are the funeral parlor and the zoo. Wherever Wen Shan loves to go, he can quietly observe the people and things around him. I may also have a so-called occupational disease. I like to observe the people I meet. It doesn’t mean that I have to find some characters for reference after I play a certain role. It’s just like Sherlock Holmes, when I see an unknown person in front of me. As I walk by, I can't help but guess about the other person's career history and family relationships, and imagine what this person was doing just now and what he has experienced.

;

;I am not used to labeling past roles. Every role is meaningful to me. It is said that film and television are the art of regret, and there is no way to do it again, but I will often reflect on it. Whenever I finish playing a role, I will think about where I did not perform well. Maybe I am not that confident. Even if others say how good I am, I will still find faults with myself.

;

;After reading the script of "It's Worth It", I started an online exchange with director Liu Jiayin that lasted for half a year.那段时间，我一直在《繁花》剧组，基本每天都要开工，只能和刘伽茵导演通过微信沟通，我们第一次见面就是定妆那天，我都已经进组开工了。

;

;合作过这么多导演，每一位的工作方法都不一样，和演员的交流相处也不一样，我觉得对于导演来说，如何启发演员、引导演员，是工作中特别重要的一部分。

;

;孔笙导演会给演员特别大的空间，他可能会给你一个大的方向，然后具体的表演方式他会特别放心地交给演员。姜伟导演同时还是非常优秀的编剧，他的剧本所有的台词都无法调整，就连语气词都非常准确。

;

;王家卫导演给我的感觉反而和之前一些媒体报道的不同，他之前的电影在拍摄的过程中可能没有特别具体的方向，但这次我感到他特别知道自己想要什么，也会表达得十分具体。当然有时候他也会让你去突破，如果能够给到他意料之外的火花，也就是更好的即兴的表演，他也会非常欣赏。

;

;有时候，角色就是不同形状的瓶子，演员就是水。每次进入到不同的角色里，演员就变成了不同的样子。所以表演是流动的，水进入瓶子之后才被固定成一个形状。我觉得导演最需要的是那个流动的瞬间，从艺术上来说，这一刻才是最美好的表达，而不是那个固定的样子。

;

;对于演员来说，很多时候因为成名了就忘记如何平视生活。平视生活是非常重要的。忘记自己从哪里来，这是一件特别要命的事情。不演戏、不工作的时候，就是回归生活，要忘记自己的职业和身份。

;

;我很羡慕那种可以卸下自己演员身份的生活状态，所以没事的时候，我总是想往远的地方走走。我每次去青海做志愿者，就有网友说我去捡垃圾什么的。其实我就是想去洗涤一下，把身上一些不属于生活的东西洗掉。

;

;很多时候大家对演员有想象，往往都带着角色滤镜，以为我们和普通人不一样。当你卸下演员这个职业回到生活里，我日常所处理的东西，无非也是今天这只猫生病了，明天那块墙皮掉下来了，浴室的热水怎么不热了……这些构成了生活，面对这些日常，我经常感到自己能力有限，比不上很多人。

;

;我常常思考演员好像是动物园里的大猩猩，一天24小时的一举一动都在大家的关注之下。很多时候大家将自己的各种好奇、审视和监督都投射在演员身上。

;

;我曾想过冲破这个牢笼，不在这个动物园待了，想要跑到大街上去。但你要知道，猩猩在动物园的时候有笼子隔着，跑到大街上可能会受到更多关注，岂不是要被围追堵截了？所以既然选择了这份职业，在得到很多的同时，就要承受它的压力，这是公平的。

;2023年9月25日晚，杭州亚运会体操项目女子资格赛暨团体决赛在黄龙体育馆进行，中国队选手亮相。

;

;2023年9月25日晚，杭州亚运会体操项目女子资格赛暨团体决赛在黄龙体育馆进行，由张欣怡、左彤、章瑾、虞琳敏、唐茜靖组成的中国队以161.896分获得冠军，实现亚运会女团13连冠，同时这也是中国体育代表团在本届亚运会夺得的第39金。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日晚，由张欣怡、左彤、章瑾、虞琳敏、唐茜靖组成的中国队以161.896分获得冠军。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日，中国队选手在比赛前进行热身。

;

;由于要在今年的世锦赛冲击奥运门票，欧钰珊、邱祺缘、张清颖三位全能高手以及周雅琴、黄卓凡两位单项高手前往安特卫普世锦赛，杭州亚运会由章瑾、唐茜靖两位参加东京奥运会的大队员率领张欣怡、左彤、虞琳敏三位国际赛场经验较少的队友参赛。其中，张欣怡、左彤、章瑾三人参加全能争夺，资格赛中出战全部四项，唐茜靖参加高低杠、平衡木、自由体操三项，虞琳敏出战跳马一项。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日，虞琳敏在跳马比赛中。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日，中国队选手章瑾在自由体操项目中。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日，唐茜靖在高低杠比赛中。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日晚，黄龙体育馆内进行亚运会体操项目，有的现场观众举起朝鲜国旗为朝鲜队支持呐喊。

;

;中国队依次进行跳马、高低杠、平衡木、自由体操四项的比拼，在四项比赛全部结束之后，中国女队以161.896分获得冠军，实现亚运会女团13连冠。日本队与朝鲜队分获亚军和季军，成绩为157.229分、156.829分。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日晚，朝鲜队以156.829分获得竞技体操项目女子团体决赛季军。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月25日，虽然乌兹别克选手丘索维金娜的左腿绑着绷带，但在杭州亚运会体操项目的比赛中仍展现了高质量的动作。

;

;48岁的乌兹别克斯坦老将丘索维金娜参加跳马与平衡木两个项目的比拼，成为本场比赛的一大看点，她排名资格赛第五，晋级跳马决赛。此前丘索维金娜对外界表示：“在代表乌兹别克斯坦赢得奖牌前，我不能结束我的职业生涯，亚运会后我还要参加2024年的巴黎奥运会。渴望是我最大的动力。我只是在做我热爱的事，为什么要停下来呢？”
